name: Rockhouse Hotel

reviews.title: Staff a bit Too friendly
reviews.text: Rockhouse is a unique and lovely location right on the rocks with ladders into 40ft. of calm warm water, fantastic for snorkeling. The round cabanas with the outdoor showers are comfortable enough, although they could be cleaner, the thatched roof is a bit skeevy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly, in fact, a bit too friendly. I would go down the road to get some fresh juice (when in Jamaica, try the soursop, delicious!) while my husband took a nap. For some reason, one of the men on the staff decided that it was acceptable to leer at me and make comments such as, "Next time your husband takes nap, you come see me!" and "I take better care of you than your husband" in a lascivious manner. Creepy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 8 nights at the Rockhouse beginning March 22 2007 in a Premium Villa (#2) and it was everything we hoped for and more. The villas are spacious, clean and the views are incredible! We had afternoon entertainment from our deck each day watching people jump from the cliffs at Pirates Cave. The gounds are extremely plush, well maintained and beautiful. The staff were all very polite, soft spoken and friendly. We travel a lot and this was by far the most relaxing vacation we have ever taken. This resort would not be for everyone. If you are looking for a place with the large resort atmosphere and amminities, skip this hotel. If you are looking for a place to unwind, relax and enjoy your surroundings, by all means, this is the place for you. The water and hotel are everything you see on their web site - amazing! We knew the showers are open air but we didn't know the toliet was also open air. At first we were concerned about bugs in the bathroom, but we didn't see a single ant or bug the enire time we were there. We weren't bothered by any mosquitos as some people in past reviews. Another thing that was a pleasant surpise was the vendors were nothing like we have read about. If you simply tell them no thank you, they leave you alone. We spent a few days at the beach and found the same there. Plus, there were not nearly as many as we expected and they were very polite. We took the Southcoast Tour with Kenney Tours one day and we would highly recommend it. You get a real feel for Jamaica and it's people by exploring and our guide (Michael) was great. If I had one complaint, it would be that they need to update their on line menu. The food is the same but the prices are higher than they state. We did enjoy the food but I feel they should have a few simple items on the dinner menu also. If you have younger people with you, I am sure they might like a burger or sandwich as an option. We have read that many people enjoyed the food at Pirates Cave, and Sips and Bites but we didn't find it to be good at all. We also ate at Rick's one day and found it to be "ok" but not great. Some of the rooms are close to the road but once you are in your room, you don't even notice it.

reviews.title: 'in a class of its own!

reviews.text: I have stayed at many hotels in the Caribbean and on Jamaica and I found the RockHouse to be the best. It has such a relaxed, romantic, beautiful atmosphere with the most unbelievable views. I don’t think there is a better place to catch a sunset. The ocean, accessed off the cliffs the hotel is built upon, is pristine. The restaurant, which sits at the top of the cliff, looks over the sea and was excellent -- I ate there every night of my 5 night stay. The staff was friendly and attentive. They had recently finished building a new spa and it was really nice with a great menu of treatments and massages. There is a totally peaceful, relaxed vibe to the place. If you are into architecture and design, you will find lots of eye candy at the RockHouse. Great pool and snack bar too. If you are looking for a pretentious, white glove spot this is not the place for you – it’s totally casual with loads of taste and style.
reviews.title: LOVED the RockHouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked in to Rockhouse at the last minute and so could only get a studio room- the sea cottages look to be amazing. However for the rock-bottom price, a small, clean room with an ocean view lanai and a huge outdoor shower ain't bad. I was impressed by small touches: great bath products, the way the minibar prices are same as the bar downstairs, the morning yoga. (Ocean view, by the way, unfortunately also means a great view of the derelict property next door).

reviews.text: The restaurant is quite good but service at breakfast is obnoxious. They must have asked to clear our plates (we were still eating) fifteen times in fifteen minutes- and we hadn't been there long (this, besides being annoying, is not very Jamaican). After all that, the check then takes twenty minutes to arrive (very Jamaican). Service at dinner, conversely, is great.

reviews.title: Beatiful Place
Terrible Food at the Rockhouse
reviews.text: We just returned from Jamaica Mar 24 '07. We stayed at Beaches Negril but had heard about the Rockhouse and decided to check it out for our next trip. Seven of us stopped in on our way back from Rick's Cafe, but unfortunately it was too late to see any of the rooms. From the outside, they looked beautiful with gorgeous views of the sea. We decided to stay for dinner and we were given a table on the outdoor patio after a short wait. Our waiter was OK at first, efficient but not very friendly or welcoming. The appetizer conch fritters were dry, flat, tasteless and unlike any conch fritters we have ever had and the bruschetta was not very tasty. My husband informed the waiter about the conch fritters and asked that they be removed from our bill. The main courses were a disaster. Everything was overcooked and dry. Expectations for this restaurant were very high but we were extremely disappointed and would not recommend this restaurant. The manager did nothing to address our concerns.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing experience. My girlfriend and I stayed at Rockhouse from March 18th-23rd. Beautiful grounds, scenery, and rooms. We stayed in room 23, a standard room. The only time we were in the room was for sleeping and getting ready for the delicious dinners we had at the hotel restaurant. The staff is awesome, they truly make you feel layed back and easy going. The Food is amazing, we ate 15 out of 17 meals there. Transportation is great, Kenny from Kenny Tours met us at the airport, and always had a driver at the front desk. For some activities I recommend taking a snorkel trip with Famous Vincent El Vira. He took my girlfriend and I out to the reef which was about a 25 minute boat ride. He then snorkeled with us, pointing out some amazing fish, and gave us food to feed the fish. It was nice to have our own private guide, as we were getting in the water a catamaran called the "wild thing" was dropping off about 35 people into the water which didnt look like much fun. The drinks at the hotel are awesome, watch out for Shane, he has a heavy hand when it comes to rum drinks. The SPA is amazing, we got a double 90 minute massage which was awesome. Any plants you might want to purchase can be taken care off on your ride from the airport, kenny will stop at a "beer stand" for Red Stripes. ROCKHOUSE ROCKS!!!!
reviews.title: Beyond relaxing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just got back this week, and we wish we could have stayed at the Rockhouse for weeks! Everything about this place is incredible. The staff is attentive and friendly, the grounds are impeccable, the pool and lounging areas can't be beat, and the food is delicious - there's really no need to eat out, if you don't want to leave. It took us about five seconds to decompress after we arrived. Shane, the bartender at the pool, made us a "Day One" when we first arrived...from then on, we had the most relaxing vacation ever. Definitely try the spa treatments (and reserve a space "on the rocks" if you can). The Blue Mountain Coffee Body Scrub was just the thing! You can rent snorkeling gear for $5 from the pool bar and then jump right off the cliffs. We saw lots of colorful fish, a stingray, and a sea turtle. The front desk staff will arrange for transportation (and has an established list of rates) anywhere you might possibly like to go around Negril, but you'll realize fast that The Rockhouse is really the best place to be. We absolutely will be going back!
reviews.title: I Love The Rockhouse
Just got home yesterday!
reviews.text: I just returned home to San Diego after a week in Jamaica. My hubby and I spent 3 nights at Rock House and was thrilled! We stayed in room 1, with an amazing view of the cliffs. The balcony of rooms 1 and 2 were amazing. My husband jumped off our balcony into the ocean. We really enjoyed being off the beaten path, and was suprised to see that all of the boat cruises companies brought their tourists to us.

I found that noise was not a problem. We were somewhat close to the road, but only heard a few horns. They are planning on opening a restaurant/bar right next to the hotel (part of the hotel), so when I return, I'll ask to stay in rooms 3-8. We stayed in the largest room and loved it. I really appreciated the mosquito nets in the rooms. The bed was phenominal and was told that some guests actually buy their beds (or similar matresses).
reviews.title: Like No Other Place on Earth!!!

description: Rockhouse is a boutique hotel stretching across the cliffs of Pristine Cove. Nestled amongst eight acres of tropical lush gardens, thatched roofed villas are perched on the water's edge. Guests swim in the sixty foot horizon pool or take the stairs carved into the rock down to the cove for snorkeling on the reef. Home to two award winning restaurants - the Rockhouse Restaurant & Bar and the Pushcart Restaurant & Rum Bar. The renowned Rockhouse Spa has a philosophy that is a simple, holistic approach to well-being, health and happiness. Spa treatments are undertaken "on-the-rocks" in the cliff-edge Massage Cabana or at the eight room garden spa. Yoga classes are offered daily overlooking the sea.Consistently ranked one of the top resorts in the Caribbean, The Rockhouse won Caribbean's Leading Boutique Hotel 2011 and Jamaica's Leading Boutique Hotel 2012 at the World Travel Awards. In addition, the Rockhouse was also voted the No. 1 "Best Value Hotel in the Caribbean" in Travel + Leisure's March 2012 "World's Best Value Awards" and included in Conde Naste Traveler's November 2011 Readers Choice list of "Best in the World".
